headline: Piper Sandler Says These 3 Energy Stocks Are Top Picks for 2026
summary: While the oil market can vary, much of that volatility tends to float on the surface – like oil on water. Underneath it, long-term trends – the currents in the water – are churning in the depths. Prices for hydrocarbon energy sources are tending downwards, facing pressures from a glut in global supplies, rising inventories, and lower-than-expected demand. The result: expectations of lower prices in 2026. Mark Lear, energy expert from Piper Sandler, has been watching the situation carefully in an
